Ingredients.2: 7 ounces dark chocolate (65 to 70% cocao), chopped into small pieces

Ingredients.3: 2 tablespoons strong brewed coffee, or more to taste

Directions.1: Grind orange zest using a mortar and pestle until it forms a smooth paste.

Directions.2: Combine chocolate, coffee, and orange zest in the top of a double boiler over simmering water. Stir frequently, scraping down the sides with a rubber spatula to avoid scorching, until chocolate is melted, about 5 minutes. Stir until smooth and remove from heat. Allow to cool slightly

Directions.3: Beat egg whites and salt in a glass, metal, or ceramic bowl until stiff peaks form (see Editor's Note).

Directions.4: Add egg yolks to the slightly cooled chocolate mixture and stir until well combined. Pour over egg whites. Carefully fold together using a spatula until just combined.

Directions.5: Pour mixture into 10 small dessert glasses or 1 large serving dish. Refrigerate at least 6 hours to overnight.
